name: Exceptional Arrow Deflection
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, shield, wall of force
full_text:
<div topic="Exceptional Arrow Deflection" level="8"><p><b>Exceptional Arrow Deflection:</b> This shield functions like a <i>shield of arrow deflection</i> except that it can deflect any type of ranged attack (including spells that require a ranged touch attack) as if it were an arrow. Any time the bearer would normally be struck by a ranged attack, he or she can make a Reflex saving throw (DC 20). If the ranged attack has an enhancement bonus (or a spell level), the DC increases by that amount. If he or she succeeds, the shield deflects the attack. The bearer must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed. Attempting to deflect a ranged attack doesn't count as an action.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 23rd; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>shield</i>,  <i>wall of force; Market Price: +</i>8 bonus.</p>
</div>

full_text:
<div topic="Infinite Arrow Deflection" level="8"><p><b>Infinite Arrow Deflection:</b> This shield functions like a <i>shield of arrow deflection</i>, though it can deflect any number of projectiles or thrown weapons each round. Any time the bearer would normally be struck by a ranged weapon, he or she can make a Reflex saving throw (DC 20). If the ranged weapon has an enhancement bonus, the DC increases by that amount. Exceptional ranged weapons, such as boulders hurled by giants or ranged spells,  can't be deflected.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>protection from arrows</i>,  <i>shield; Market Price: +</i>6 bonus.</p>

full_text:
<div topic="Negating" level="8"><p><b>Negating:</b> Immediately after the wearer of this armor is hit with a magic weapon, the armor casts <i>greater dispel magic</i> on the weapon. (In the case of projectile weapons, the armor casts <i>greater dispel magic</i> on the weapon that fired the projectile if it is in range. If it is out of range, the armor does nothing.) No weapon can be affected by the armor more than once per day (regardless of the success of the dispel check).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>greater dispel magic; Market Price: +</i>5 bonus.</p>
</div>

name: Armor of the Abyssal Horde
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, creator must be evil, energy drain
full_text:
<div topic="Armor of the Abyssal Horde" level="8"><p><b>Armor of the Abyssal Horde:</b> This+<i>6 full plate armor's</i> clawed gauntlets are effectively +4 keen weapons (1d10/19-20) that afflict the target as if she had been struck by an <i>energy drain</i> spell (Fortitude negates DC 23). The armor bestows two negative levels on any nonevil creature wearing it. These negative levels persist as long as the armor is worn and disappear when the armor is removed. The negative levels never result in actual level loss, but they cannot be overcome in any way (including <i>restoration</i> spells) while the armor is worn.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, creator must be evil, <i>energy drain; Market Price:</i> 768,260 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 385,260 gp + 17,660 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Armor of the Celestial Battalion
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, creator must be good, magic circle against evil
full_text:
<div topic="Armor of the Celestial Battalion" level="8"><p><b>Armor of the Celestial Battalion:</b> This+<i>7 chainmail</i> is so fine and light that it can be worn under normal clothing without revealing its presence. It has a maximum Dexterity bonus of +10, no armor check penalty, and an arcane spell failure chance of 10%. It is considered light armor, and it allows the wearer to fly at will (as the <i>fly</i> spell). Furthermore, the wearer is at all times surrounded by a <i>magic circle against evil</i> effect (as the spell) which, if dispelled, can be created again as a free action.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, creator must be good, <i>magic circle against evil; Market Price:</i> 616,300 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 308,300 gp + 16,160 XP.</p>
</div>

full_text:
<div topic="Warlord's Breastplate" level="8"><p><b>Warlord's Breastplate:</b> This +<i>6 mithral breastplate</i> has an armor check penalty of -1, a maximum Dexterity bonus of +5, and an arcane spell failure chance of 15%. It is considered light armor and weighs 15 pounds. It grants the wearer a +4 enhancement bonus to Charisma and allows the wearer to attract and lead a number of followers as if he or she had the Leadership feat (though this power doesn't allow the wearer to attract a cohort). If the wearer already has the Leadership feat, this armor has no cumulative effect on his or her followers.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>charm monster</i>,  <i>sympathy; Market Price:</i> 416,200 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 210,200 gp + 14,120 XP.</p><p/>

name: Acidic Blast
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, acid fog
full_text:
<div topic="Acidic Blast" level="8"><p><b>Acidic Blast:</b> On command, an acidic blast weapon drips acid (though this deals no damage to the wielder). On any hit, this acid splashes the creature struck, dealing +3d6 points of bonus acid damage. On a successful critical hit it instead deals +6d6 points of acid damage (or +9d6 if the critical multiplier is x3, or +12d6 if the critical multiplier is x4). Bows, crossbows, and slings with this special ability bestow the bonus acid damage upon their ammunition.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>acid fog; Market Price: +</i>6 bonus.</p>
</div>

name: Anarchic Power
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, word of chaos
full_text:
<div topic="Anarchic Power" level="8"><p><b>Anarchic Power:</b> This weapon is chaos-aligned and thus bypasses the corresponding damage reduction. When a weapon of anarchic power strikes a lawful target, this power deals +3d6 points of bonus chaotic damage to the target, and the target gains one negative level (Fortitude DC 23 to remove 24 hours later). On a successful critical hit it instead deals +6d6 points of chaotic damage and bestows two negative levels (or +9d6 and three negative levels if the critical multiplier is x3, or +12d6 and four negative levels if the critical multiplier is x4). The weapon bestows three negative levels on any lawful creature attempting to wield it. These negative levels remain as long as the weapon is in hand and disappear when the weapon is no longer wielded. These negative levels never result in actual level loss, but they cannot be overcome in any way (including <i>restoration</i> spells) while the weapon is wielded. Bows, crossbows, and slings with this special ability bestow the anarchic power upon their ammunition. This special ability does not stack with the nonepic anarchic special ability. </p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>word of chaos; Market Price: +</i>8 bonus.</p>
</div>

name: Everdancing
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, animate objects
full_text:
<div topic="Everdancing" level="8"><p><b>Everdancing:</b> An everdancing weapon is much like a dancing weapon, though it can be loosed with a free action and will fight as long as desired. It can move up to 60 feet away from its owner. Its owner can instruct it to move to a different target as a move-equivalent action. If its owner is rendered unconscious or otherwise unable to direct it, it will fight the same opponent as long as that opponent is conscious and within range. The owner of an everdancing weapon can grasp it again as a free action (assuming it is within reach).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 23rd; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>animate objects; Market Price: +</i>8 bonus.</p>
</div>

name: Triple-Throw
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, shades
full_text:
<div topic="Triple-Throw" level="8"><p><b>Triple-Throw:</b> This special ability can only be placed on a weapon that can be thrown. (If this property is rolled for a weapon that cannot be thrown, reroll.) A triple-throw weapon creates two duplicates of itself when thrown. Both the original and the duplicate weapons attack separately (at the same attack bonus). Regardless of the success of any of the attacks, the duplicates immediately disappear after the attack is completed. Any bonuses on damage due to accuracy or precision (including those from sneak attacks, the Precise Shot feat, or the ranger's favored enemy bonus) apply only to the original weapon's damage, not to the duplicates.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>shades; Market Price: +</i>6 bonus.</p>
</div>

name: Unerring Accuracy
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, true seeing
full_text:
<div topic="Unerring Accuracy" level="8"><p><b>Unerring Accuracy:</b> Ranged attacks made with this weapon negate the AC bonus granted by any cover short of total cover.  The weapon's ranged attacks also ignore any miss chance from concealment (including total concealment, but the must still aim his or her attacks at the correct square).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>true seeing; Market Price: +</i>6 bonus.</p>
</div>

name: Unholy Power
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, unholy word
full_text:
<div topic="Unholy Power" level="8"><p><b>Unholy Power:</b> This weapon is evil-aligned and this bypasses the corresponding damage reduction. When a weapon of unholy power strikes a good target, this power erupts forth and deals +3d6 points of bonus unholy (evil) damage to the target, and the target gains one negative level (Fortitude DC 23 to remove 24 hours later). On a successful critical hit it instead deals +6d6 points of unholy (evil) damage and bestows two negative levels (or +9d6 and three negative levels if the critical multiplier is x3, or +12d6 and four negative levels if the critical multiplier is x4). The weapon bestows three negative levels on any good creature attempting to wield it. These negative levels remain as long as the weapon is in hand and disappear when the weapon is no longer wielded. These negative levels never result in actual level loss, but they cannot be overcome in any way (including <i>restoration</i> spells) while the weapon is wielded. Bows, crossbows, and slings with this special ability bestow the unholy power upon their ammunition. This special ability does not stack with the nonepic unholy special ability.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 23rd; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>unholy word; Market Price: +</i>8 bonus.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Backstabber
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, inflict moderate wounds
full_text:
<div topic="Backstabber" level="8"><p><b>Backstabber:</b> This +<i>6 short sword</i> adds +2d6 to the wielder's sneak attack damage. If the wielder does not have the sneak attack ability, this weapon does not grant it.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>inflict moderate</i> <i>wounds; Market Price:</i> 770,310 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 385,310 gp + 17,700 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Chaosbringer
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, rage, mass charm monster
full_text:
<div topic="Chaosbringer" level="8"><p><b>Chaosbringer:</b> This +<i>6 greataxe of anarchic power</i> grants its wielder the ability to fly into a rage (identical to a barbarian's rage) once per day (or one additional time per day if the wielder already has the rage class feature). If the wielder has the greater rage class feature, the weapon also grants the wielder the Incite Rage epic feat.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 23rd; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>rage</i>,  <i>mass charm monster; Market Price:</i> 4,025,350 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 2,012,850 gp + 50,250 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Elven Greatbow
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, bull's strength, keen edge, true seeing
full_text:
<div topic="Elven Greatbow" level="8"><p><b>Elven Greatbow:</b> In the hands of any nonelf, this bow performs only as a +<i>2 composite longbow</i>. In the hands of an elf, this weapon functions as a +<i>5 composite longbow of unerring accuracy</i> with a Strength bonus that matches its elven wielder's current Strength at all times. Furthermore, any arrows loosed from the bow are considered keen, regardless of the enhancement bonus of the arrow fired.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 23rd; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>bull's strength</i>,  <i>keen edge</i>,  <i>true seeing; Market Price:</i> 2,900,400 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 1,450,400 gp + 39,400 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Everwhirling Chain
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, animate objects, haste, shield (or shield of faith)
full_text:
<div topic="Everwhirling Chain" level="8"><p><b>Everwhirling Chain:</b> This +<i>4 defending everdancing spiked chain of speed</i> continuously twitches in its wielder's hands. The wielder of the <i>everwhirling chain</i> can use it to make any number of attacks of opportunity per round (as if he or she had the Improved Combat Reflexes feat).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 23rd; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>animate objects</i>,  <i>haste</i>,  <i>shield</i> (or <i>shield of faith</i>); <i>Market Price:</i> 5,220,325 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 2,610,325 gp + 52,200 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Finaldeath
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, death ward, plane shift, summon monster IX, creator must be able to turn undead
full_text:
<div topic="Finaldeath" level="8"><p><b>Finaldeath:</b> This +<i>5 undead dread ghost touch morningstar</i> also grants its wielder immunity to energy drain attacks. Furthermore, if its wielder is capable of turning undead, he or she gains the Positive Energy Aura feat.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 22nd; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>death ward</i>,  <i>plane shift</i>,  <i>summon monster IX</i>,  creator must be able to turn undead; <i>Market Price:</i> 3,580,308 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 1,790,308 gp + 45,800 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Gripsoul
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, binding
full_text:
<div topic="Gripsoul" level="8"><p><b>Gripsoul:</b> <i>Gripsoul</i> is a +<i>6 keen long-sword</i>,  but instead of dealing additional damage on a critical hit, the weapon imprisons the victim in a gem set in the pommel of the sword as per a <i>binding</i> spell heightened to 16th level (DC 30). The same is true of any blow that would otherwise kill a foe or knock him or her unconscious. Only one creature can be so held, but the wielder can release the bound soul at any time with a command word.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 27th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>binding; Market Price:</i> 1,856,500 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 934,500 gp + 28,440 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Holy Devastator
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, holy aura, holy smite, holy word
full_text:
<div topic="Holy Devastator" level="8"><p><b>Holy Devastator:</b> In the hands of any character other than a paladin, this sword performs as a +<i>3 holy longsword</i>. In the hands of a paladin, this weapon functions as a +<i>7 longsword of holy power</i> and grants a +5 sacred bonus on the wielder's saving throws against spells with the evil descriptor or spells cast by evil characters. If the paladin wielder smites evil with the <i>holy devastator</i>,  he or she adds twice his or her paladin level to damage (rather than his or her paladin level).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 23rd; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>holy aura</i>,  <i>holy smite</i>,  <i>holy word; Market Price:</i> 4,620,315 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 2,310,315 gp + 56,200 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Mace of Ruin
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, disintegrate
full_text:
<div topic="Mace of Ruin" level="8"><p><b>Mace of Ruin:</b> This +<i>7 heavy mace</i> ignores the hardness or damage reduction of any object or creature it strikes. Furthermore, the weapon can deal critical hits to objects and constructs as if they were living creatures.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>disintegrate; Market Price:</i> 1,000,312 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 500,312 gp + 20,000 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Quarterstaff of Alacrity
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, protection from arrows, shield
full_text:
<div topic="Quarterstaff of Alacrity" level="8"><p><b>Quarterstaff of Alacrity:</b> Both ends of this +<i>5 quarterstaff of speed</i> have equal enhancement and special powers, meaning that it allows an additional attack with each end every round. While the <i>Quarterstaff of alacrity</i> is held, it grants its wielder a +5 resistance bonus on Reflex saves. It also deflects ranged weapons as if the wielder had the Deflect Arrows and Infinite Deflection feats.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>protection from arrows</i>,  <i>shield; Market Price:</i> 462,600 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 231,600 gp + 14,620 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Souldrinker
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, Spell Focus (Necromancy), energy drain
full_text:
<div topic="Souldrinker" level="8"><p><b>Souldrinker:</b> This +<i>5 bastard sword</i> bestows 2d4 negative levels on its target whenever it deals damage, just as if its target had been struck by the <i>energy drain</i> spell. Each negative level bestowed grants the wielder 5 temporary hit points. One day after being struck, the subject must make a Fortitude save (DC 25) for each negative level or lose a level. If this sword's power causes a character to have negative levels at least equal to his or her current level, the character is instantly slain and the wielder gains an additional 10 temporary hit points. Temporary hit points gained from this weapon last for a maximum of 1 hour.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, Spell Focus (Necromancy), <i>energy drain; Market Price:</i> 478,335 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 239,315 gp + 14,780 XP.</p>
</div>

full_text:

Furthermore, the wielder can move normally (including flying) even in the strongest winds. When the weapon is drawn, the wielder gains electricity resistance 30 and sonic resistance 30.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, <i>blindness/deafness</i>,  <i>call lightning</i> or <i>lightning bolt</i>,  <i>control winds</i>,  <i>fly</i>,  <i>protection from energy; Market Price:</i> 235,350 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 117,850 gp + 12,350 XP.</p>

This is a nonepic magic item.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 15th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Forge Ring, <i>protection from energy; Market Price:</i> 84,000 gp.</p><p/><p/>

name: Epic Wizardry V
prereq: Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, wish
full_text:
<div topic="Epic Wizardry" level="8"><p><b>Epic Wizardry:</b> Like the <i>ring of wizardry</i>,  this ring comes in a variety of types useful only to arcane spellcasters. The wearer's arcane spells per day are doubled for one particular spell level. An <i>epic ring of wizardry V</i> doubles 5th-level spells, an <i>epic ring of wizardry VI</i> doubles 6th-level spells, an <i>epic ring of wizardry VII</i> doubles 7th-level spells, an <i>epic ring of wizardry VIII</i> doubles 8th-level spells, and an <i>epic ring of wizardry IX</i> doubles 9th-level spells. Bonus spells from high ability scores, school specialization, or any other source are not doubled.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 23rd (<i>epic wizardry</i> V), 26th (<i>epic wizardry VI</i>), 29th (<i>epic wizardry VII</i>), 32nd (<i>epic wizardry VIII</i>), 35th (<i>epic wizardry IX</i>); <i>Prerequisites:</i> Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, <i>wish; Market Price:</i> 250,000 gp (<i>epic wizardry</i> V), 360,000 gp (<i>epic wizardry VI</i>), 490,000 gp (<i>epic wizardry VII</i>), 640,000 gp (<i>epic wizardry VIII</i>), 810,000 gp (<i>epic wizardry IX</i>).</p>
</div>

full_text:
<div topic="Rapid Healing" level="8"><p><b>Rapid Healing:</b> This ring grants a living wearer fast healing 3. It must be worn for 24 hours before its powers activate, and if removed it will not function again until it has been worn for 24 hours by the same individual.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, <i>regenerate; Market Price:</i> 300,000 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Sequestering
prereq: Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, sequester
full_text:
<div topic="Sequestering" level="8"><p><b>Sequestering:</b> This ring becomes invisible when worn. Upon command, the wearer gains the benefits of a <i>sequester</i> spell (though he or she does not become comatose as normal for the spell).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, <i>sequester; Market Price:</i> 300,000 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Universal Energy Immunity
prereq: Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, protection from energy
full_text:
<div topic="Universal Energy Immunity" level="8"><p><b>Universal Energy Immunity:</b> This ring functions as a <i>ring of energy immunity</i> for all types of energy- fire, cold, electricity, acid, and sonic. The wearer takes no damage from energy of any of these types.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, <i>protection from energy; Market Price:</i> 2,160,000 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Universal Energy Resistance, Greater
prereq: Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, protection from energy
full_text:
<div topic="Universal Energy Resistance, Greater" level="8"><p><b>Universal Energy Resistance, Greater:</b> This ring functions as a <i>ring of greater energy resistance</i> for all types of energy-fire, cold, electricity, acid, and sonic. When the wearer would normally take such damage, subtract 30 points of damage per round from the amount before applying.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, <i>protection from energy; Market Price:</i> 308,000 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 154,000 gp + 13,080 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Virtuous Good
prereq: Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, holy aura, creator must be good
full_text:
<div topic="Virtuous Good" level="8"><p><b>Virtuous Good:</b> The wearer of this ring is constantly sheathed in a <i>holy aura</i> effect. It bestows one negative level on any evil creature that puts it on. The negative level remains as long as the ring is worn and disappears when the ring is removed. This negative level never results in actual level loss, but it cannot be over-come in any way (including <i>restoration</i> spells) while the ring is worn.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 15th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, <i>holy aura</i>,  creator must be good; <i>Market Price:</i> 250,000 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 125,000 gp + 12,500 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Weaponbreaking
prereq: Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, iron body, shatter
full_text:
<div topic="Weaponbreaking" level="8"><p><b>Weaponbreaking:</b> A <i>ring of weaponbreaking</i> is identical to a <i>ring of ironskin</i>,  and has one additional power. Any weapon that successfully strikes the wearer must also make a Fortitude saving throw (DC 20) or be shattered into pieces.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Forge Ring, Forge Epic Ring, <i>iron body</i>,  <i>shatter; Market Price:</i> 600,000 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 300,000 gp + 16,000 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Epic Psionics V
prereq: Craft Universal Item, Craft Epic Universal Item, great emulation
full_text:
<div topic="Epic Psionics" level="8"><p><b>Epic Psionics:</b> This special crystal ring comes in a variety of types useful only to psionic characters (characters who have power points per day). The wearer's total power points per day are increased, depending on the ring. The points granted are not bonus points-while the ring is worn, it actually increases the wearer's points per day, but a night's rest is required before gaining access to the increased power point per day total. (Power points are not actually stored in the ring, as would be the case for a crystal capacitor. Instead, the ring grants power points by magnifying the manifester's own power.)</p><p>A <i>ring of epic psionics V</i> increases the wearer's daily power points by 43 points, a <i>ring of epic psionics VI</i> grants 63 power points, a <i>ring of epic psionics VII</i> grants 87 power points, a <i>ring of epic psionics VIII</i> grants 115 points, and a <i>ring of epic psionics IX</i> grants 147 power points.</p><p><i>Manifester Level:</i> 23rd (<i>epic psionics</i> V), 26th (<i>epic psionics VI</i>), 29th (<i>epic psionics VII</i>), 32nd (<i>epic psionics VIII</i>), 35th (<i>epic psionics IX</i>); <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Universal Item, Craft Epic Universal Item, <i>great emulation; Market Price:</i> 250,000 gp (<i>epic psionics</i> V), 360,000 gp (<i>epic psionics VI</i>), 490,000 gp (<i>epic psionics VII</i>), 640,000 gp (<i>epic psionics VIII</i>), 810,000 gp (<i>epic psionics IX</i>).</p><p/>
</div>

name: Besiegement
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Craft Magic Arms and Armor, clenched fist, passwall, telepathic bond, transmute rock to mud
full_text:
<div topic="Besiegement" level="8"><p><b>Besiegement:</b>  This rod functions as a +<i>3 light mace</i>. In addition, it is useful for besieging fortifications. Whenever the wielder makes a charge attack, the rod improves to a +6 weapon. Twice per day, the rod can create a battering ram that lasts for 24 rounds. This ram can strike once per round, dealing 20 points of damage with each hit. It cannot be used to target individuals, only fortifications. It can be damaged by normal means (65 hp, AC 22), and <i>disintegrate</i> or <i>dispel magic</i> destroys it. The rod also has the following powers: <i>Siege Engine:</i> One heavy catapult, two light catapults, or three siege towers may be generated with each use of this power. Each weapon created lasts for 12 hours.  The power can be used three times per day. Ammunition for 20 shots is included with each weapon created.</p><p><i>Transmute Rock to Mud:</i> This power can be used three times per day (caster level 24th, save DC 17).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 24th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>clenched fist</i>,  <i>passwall</i>,   <i>telepathic bond</i>,  <i>transmute rock to mud; Market Price:</i> 447,745 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 224,025 gp + 14,474 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Epic Absorption
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Empower Spell, Maximize Spell, empowered maximized spell turning
full_text:
<div topic="Epic Absorption" level="8"><p><b>Epic Absorption:</b> Like a <i>rod of absorption</i>,  this rod draws single-target or ray spells and spell-like abilities into itself, nullifying the effect and storing the potential spell levels until the wielder releases the energy in the form of spells of his or her own. Spells of any level (including those boosted beyond 9th level by metamagic) can be absorbed, although epic spells cannot. The rod absorbs a maximum of 150 spell levels and can thereafter only discharge any remaining potential it might have. The rod cannot be recharged.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 23rd; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Empower Spell, Maximize Spell, empowered maximized <i>spell turning; Market Price:</i> 1,500,000 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Epic Cancellation
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, dispel magic
full_text:
<div topic="Epic Cancellation" level="8"><p><b>Epic Cancellation:</b> This rod's touch drains an item of all magical properties, including the magical energy in epic magic items (but not most artifacts). The item touched gets a Will saving throw (DC 26). If a creature is holding the magic item at the time, then the item can use the holder's Will save bonus in place of its own. In such cases, contact is established by making a melee touch attack roll. Upon draining three items, the rod becomes brittle and useless. Drained items can only be restored by <i>wish</i>,  <i>miracle</i>,  or epic spells specifically designed to restore lost power. A <i>rod of epic cancellation</i> can neutralize a normal <i>sphere of annihilation</i> without itself being cancelled.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 25th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, <i>dispel magic; Market Price:</i> 330,000 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Epic Might
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, cure critical wounds, inflict critical wounds, bull's strength, fireball, dominate person, power word stun

name: Epic Negation
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, dispel magic, limited wish or miracle
full_text:
<div topic="Epic Negation" level="8"><p><b>Epic Negation:</b> This rod negates the spell or spell-like function or functions of magic items, including epic magic items (but not artifacts). The wielder points the rod at the magic item, and a beam shoots forth to touch the target device, attacking as a ray (a ranged touch attack). The ray negates any currently active item function and has a 75% chance to negate any other spell or spell-like functions of that device, regardless of the level or power of the functions, for 2d4 rounds. To negate instantaneous effects, the rod wielder needs to have readied an action. The target item gets no saving throw or means to resist this effect. The rod can function three times per day.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 24th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, <i>dispel magic</i>,  <i>limited wish</i> or <i>miracle; Market Price:</i> 446,000 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Epic Rulership
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Improved Heighten Spell, improved heightened mass charm
full_text:
<div topic="Epic Rulership" level="8"><p><b>Epic Rulership:</b> This rod appears to be a royal scepter worth at least 25,000 gp in materials and work-manship alone. The wielder can command the obedience and fealty of creatures within 360 feet when he or she activates the device (a standard action). Creatures totaling 900 Hit Dice can be ruled, but creatures with Intelligence scores of 17 or higher are entitled to a Will saving throw (DC 29) to negate the effect. Ruled creatures obey the wielder as if he or she were their absolute sovereign. Still, if the wielder gives a command that is contrary to the nature of the creatures commanded, the magic is broken. The rod can be used for 1,500 total minutes before crumbling to dust. This duration need not be continuous.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 25th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Improved Heighten Spell, improved heightened <i>mass charm; Market Price:</i> 575,000 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 300,000 gp + 15,500 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Epic Spellcaster
full_text:
<div topic="Epic Spellcaster" level="8"><p><b>Epic Spellcaster:</b> This magnificent adamantine rod grants its wielder a +10 insight bonus on Spellcraft checks made to cast epic spells for as long as he or she holds or carries the rod.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod; <i>Market Price:</i> 245,400 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Epic Splendor
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, fabricate, mage's magnificent mansion
full_text:
<div topic="Epic Splendor" level="8"><p><b>Epic Splendor:</b> This rod grants its wielder a +8 enhancement bonus to Charisma for as long as he or she holds or carries the item. Three times per day, the rod creates and garbs him or her in clothing of the finest fabrics, plus adornments of fur and jewels. Apparel created by the rod can remain in existence up to 24 hours. The value of the garb ranges from 70,000 to 100,000 gp (1d4+6 x10,000 gp)-10,000 gp for the fabric, 50,000 gp for the furs, and the rest for jewel trim (maximum of 40 gems, maximum value 1,000 gp each). In addition, the rod can, once per week, create a palatial mansion in any floor plan the user desires. The mansion is palatial, able to accommodate up to 250 people, housing them in private chambers and serving them fine banquets. The mansion lasts for three days, after which time it, and everything originally in it (including items removed from the mansion), disappear.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, <i>fabricate</i>,  <i>mage's magnificent mansion; Market Price:</i> 297,400 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 191,200 gp + 12,124 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Excellent Magic
full_text:
<div topic="Excellent Magic" level="8"><p><b>Excellent Magic:</b> Once per day when casting a nonepic or epic spell that has an experience point component, the rod supplies up to 2,000 XP, not the caster. If more experience points are required to cast the spell, the caster provides them. As a special use of the rod, the caster can substitute the power inherent in the rod for the experience point development cost of an epic spell. Doing so drains all the power from the rod, rendering it useless.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod; <i>Market Price:</i> 650,000 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 325,000 gp + 26,000 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Fortification
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Craft Magic Arms and Armor, inter-posing hand, create food and water, major creation, wall of iron, wall of stone
full_text:
<div topic="Fortification" level="8"><p><b>Fortification:</b> This rod functions as a +<i>3 light mace</i>. In addition, it is useful for the construction and defense of fortifications. Whenever the wielder is benefiting from cover, the rod improves that to nine-tenths cover (+10 cover AC bonus and +4 cover Reflex save bonus; failure on the save results in half damage and success results in no damage). Three times per day, the rod can create food and water, as per the cleric spell, for twenty-four people. The rod also has the following powers: <i>Fortify:</i> Four times per day, a stone wall can be created that is 12 inches thick, 10 feet high, and 30 feet long. This wall has a parapet and battlements across the top. (Alternatively, the power can be used to mend a broken existing wall. The gap to be filled can be no more than 300 square feet in area.) In addition, once per day, a great door of iron can be created that is set into one of the newly created walls. This door, 4 inches thick, may be a double door, a drawbridge, or a portcullis, as chosen by the wielder. <i>Siege Engine:</i> One heavy catapult, two light catapults, or three ballistae may be generated with each use of this power. The power can be used four times per day. Ammunition for 20 shots is included with each weapon created.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 24th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>inter-posing hand</i>,  <i>create food and water</i>,  <i>major creation</i>,  <i>wall of iron</i>,  <i>wall of stone; Market Price:</i> 465,665 gp; <i>Cost to Create:</i> 231,985 gp + 14,634 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Invulnerability
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, iron body, resistance, spell resistance

name: Nightmares
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, nightmare, permanency, wail of the banshee
full_text:
<div topic="Nightmares" level="8"><p><b>Nightmares:</b> Anyone who comes within 20 feet of the wielder of this rod feels a grave sense of unease. Each person so affected must make a Will save (DC 17) or suffer the effects of a <i>nightmare</i> spell the next time he or she falls asleep. The wielder is immune to this effect. Three times per day, the wielder can utter a command word that causes the rod to emit a horrid, inhuman scream. Up to twenty of the closest creatures within a 30-foot radius who hear this terrible wail believe that their worst nightmares have become reality and suffer the effects of a <i>wail of the banshee</i> spell (DC 23).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, <i>nightmare</i>,  <i>permanency</i>,  <i>wail of the banshee; Market Price:</i> 284,000 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Paradise
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Improved Heighten Spell, improved heightened gate
full_text:
<div topic="Paradise" level="8"><p><b>Paradise:</b> This item creates a nondimensional space, similar in effect to a <i>rod of security</i>. However, the rod's possessor and up to 999 other creatures can stay in complete safety for up to 1,000 days divided by the number of creatures affected. Natural healing takes place at five times the normal pace. The rod functions like its nonepic counterpart in all other ways.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 24th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Improved Heighten Spell, improved heightened <i>gate; Market Price:</i> 610,000 gp.</p>
</div>

name: The Path
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, find the path, freedom of movement, pass without trace, wall of stone
full_text:
<div topic="Path" level="8"><p><b>The Path:</b> This rod serves as an aid to trailblazing and travel. It grants the wielder a +30 enhancement bonus on Wilderness Lore checks for tracking and Intuit Direction checks. The handle of the rod is hollow, functioning like a telescope. When the wielder peers through it, the limits of vision are three times normal (and spotting distances for encounters are tripled). In addition, the telescoping handle enables the wielder to view things as though affected by a <i>true seeing</i> spell. The rod also has the following powers. <i>Map:</i> Three times per day a section of the rod unrolls like a scroll from a tube, revealing a map of the surrounding area, centered on the location of the rod. The area shown on the map covers an area as small as 50 feet in radius to as large as 24 miles in radius, zooming in or out with a set of command words. The map reveals natural topography and all types of structures (even hidden ones), but it will not show the location of creatures.</p><p><i>Passage:</i> Three times per day, this power allows the wielder and up to five others in a 20-foot radius to move unhindered through natural plant growth or bodies of water (as per the <i>freedom of movement</i> spell).</p><p><i>Bridge:</i> Once per day, this power allows the user to create a 5-foot-wide, 40-foot-long stone cause-way across chasms and canyons. The bridge created lasts for 1 hour.</p><p><i>Pass without Trace:</i> Once per day, this power can be used on the wielder and twenty others, for 21 minutes. It is otherwise as the spell of the same name (caster level 24th).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, <i>find the path</i>,  <i>freedom of movement</i>,  <i>pass without trace</i>,  <i>wall of stone; Market Price:</i> 306,870 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Restless Death
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, animate dead, control undead, slay living
full_text:
<div topic="Restless Death" level="8"><p><b>Restless Death:</b> The holder of this rod can rebuke or control undead as if he or she were four levels higher. (The rod doesn't grant the ability to rebuke or control undead if the holder doesn't already have it.) In addition, the wielder may speak a command word to cast <i>animate dead</i>. Any skeletons or zombies animated by the rod's power are automatically controlled by the rod, up to the rod's maximum limit of 42 HD, and they follow the orders of the rod's wielder. These undead don't count toward the wielder's limit of controlled undead. Finally, the wielder can speak a second command word to cast <i>slay living</i> (heightened to 10th level; DC 25).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, <i>animate dead</i>,  <i>control undead</i>,  <i>slay living; Market Price:</i> 625,000 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Wyrm, Brass
prereq: Craft Rod, Craft Epic Rod, Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor, Improved Heighten Spell, improved heightened polymorph, creator must be same alignment as dragon type
full_text:
<div topic="Wyrm" level="8"><p><b>Wyrm:</b> Any of the various rods in this series functions as a +<i>5 quarterstaff</i>. Upon casting the rod to the ground (a standard action) and uttering a command word, the rod grows into a specific type of dragon (depending on the specific type of rod) by the end of the round. The dragon created is a wyrm and obeys the commands of the owner. The dragon returns to rod form (a full-round action) whenever the wielder desires, or whenever it moves farther than 500 feet from the owner. If the dragon form is slain, it returns to rod form and cannot be activated again for three days. name: Boots of Swiftness
prereq: Craft Wondrous Item, Craft Epic Wondrous Item, cat's grace, expeditious retreat, haste, jump
full_text:
<div topic="Boots of Swiftness" level="8"><p><b>Boots of Swiftness:</b> These shoes grant their wearer a +6 enhancement bonus to Dexterity. The wearer's speed doubles (this does not stack with any magical or supernatural enhancement to speed), he or she gains the evasion ability (as the rogue class feature), and the wearer's jumping distance is not limited by his or her height. The wearer gains a +20 competence bonus on Balance, Climb, Jump, and Tumble checks. Three times per day, the wearer can utter a command word to activate the boots' <i>haste</i> power (as the <i>haste</i> spell, lasts 20 rounds).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Wondrous Item, Craft Epic Wondrous Item, <i>cat's grace</i>,  <i>expeditious retreat</i>,  <i>haste</i>,  <i>jump; Market Price:</i> 256,000 gp; <i>Weight:</i> 1 lb.</p>
</div>

name: Bracers of Epic Armor +11
prereq: Craft Wondrous Item, Craft Epic Wondrous Item, mage armor, creator's caster level must be twice the bracers' bonus
full_text:
<div topic="Bracers of Epic Armor" level="8"><p><b>Bracers of Epic Armor:</b> These items surround the wearer with an invisible but tangible field of force, granting him or her an armor bonus of +11 or higher, just as though he or she were wearing armor. Both bracers must be worn for the magic to be effective.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Wondrous Item, Craft Epic Wondrous Item, <i>mage armor</i>,  creator's caster level must be twice the bracers' bonus; <i>Market Price:</i> 1,210,000 (+11), 1,440,000 (+12), 1,690,000 gp (+13), 1,960,000 (+14), 2,250,000 gp (+15); <i>Weight:</i> 1 lb.</p>
</div>

name: Gate Key
prereq: Craft Wondrous Item, Craft Epic Wondrous Item, gate
full_text:
<div topic="Gate Key" level="8"><p><b>Gate Key:</b> When properly operated, the gate key can be used to attune any bounded space, such as a doorway or a cave opening, to another bounded space on another plane of existence previously visited by the wielder. When two bounded spaces are attuned, an interdimensional portal springs up at each location, and the two portals are connected. When the wielder creates a pair of portals, he or she also establishes the necessary key that travelers must have to access the portal. Possible keys include nothing, a pearl, a particular hair color, or even the <i>Gate key</i> itself. Up to sixty different pairs of portals can be attuned in this manner. Once all sixty pairs of portals are created, the key cannot create additional gates, though it may still be the necessary key to access some or all of the portals. To any creature without the proper key, the interdimensional portals are not visible (through <i>True seeing</i> or similar magic reveals their presence).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 21st; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Wondrous Item, Craft Epic Wondrous Item, <i>gate; Market Price:</i> 378,000 gp; <i>Weight:</i> 1 lb.</p>
</div>

name: Horseshoes of the Peerless Steed
prereq: Craft Wondrous Item, Craft Epic Wondrous Item, Ride skill, haste, spell resistance
full_text:
<div topic="Horseshoes of the Peerless Steed" level="8"><p><b>Horseshoes of the Peerless Steed:</b> These horseshoes magically adhere to the feet of any hoofed creature. Anyone riding the creature gains a +10 competence bonus on Ride checks and is treated as having ranks in the appropriate Ride skill (and thus does not take the -5 penalty for riding an unfamiliar mount). The horseshoes grant the creature (or its rider, as appropriate) the effects of the Trample, Ride-by Attack, and Spirited Charge feats. The wearer of the horseshoes gains spell resistance 32 against enchantment effects. In addition, the ground speed of the creature wearing the horseshoes doubles.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Wondrous Item, Craft Epic Wondrous Item, Ride skill, <i>haste</i>,  <i>spell resistance; Market Price:</i> 217,000 gp; <i>Weight:</i> 1 lb. each.</p>
</div>

It grants the wearer spell resistance 40.</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 29th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Wondrous Item, Craft Epic Wondrous Item, <i>spell resistance; Market Price:</i> 290,000 gp; <i>Weight:</i> 1 lb.</p>

The wearer's outline is blurry and indistinct, granting concealment (20% miss chance) at all times (as the <i>blur</i> spell). The mantle also grants nondetection to its wearer (as the spell).</p><p><i>Caster Level:</i> 20th; <i>Prerequisites:</i> Craft Wondrous Item, Craft Epic Wondrous Item, <i>blur</i>,  <i>invisibility</i>,  <i>nondetection</i>,  <i>silence; Market Price:</i> 242,000 gp; <i>Weight:</i> 1 lb.</p>
</div>

name: Axe of the Dwarvish Lords
full_text:
<div topic="Axe of the Dwarvish Lords" level="8"><p><b>Axe of the Dwarvish Lords:</b> This is a +<i>6 keen throwing goblinoid bane dwarven waraxe</i>. Any dwarf who holds it doubles the range of his or her darkvision. Any nondwarf who grasps the <i>Axe</i> takes 2 points of temporary Charisma damage; these points cannot be healed or restored in any way while the <i>Axe</i> is held. The current owner of the <i>Axe</i> gains a +10 bonus on Craft (armorsmithing, blacksmithing, gemcutting, stonemasonry, and weaponsmithing) checks. The wielder of the <i>Axe</i> can summon an elder earth elemental (as <i>summon monster IX</i>; duration 20 rounds) once per week.</p>
</div>

name: Codex of the Infinite Planes
Cup and Talisman of the Demigod
full_text:
<div topic="Cup and Talisman of the Demigod" level="8"><p><b>Cup and Talisman of the Demigod:</b> The <i>Cup</i> is a large gem-set golden chalice requiring two hands to lift. It emits light (as the <i>daylight</i> spell) at all times and automatically dispels any darkness-based spells whose area it enters. If the cup is filled with holy water (requiring a full gallon), that substance will act as a <i>potion of cure critical wounds</i> or a <i>potion of neutralize poison</i> (owner's choice) if drunk. This liquid can't be saved or stored in any way. The <i>Talisman</i> is a small eight-pointed platinum star hanging from a chain of gold and pearls. The wearer gains a +6 enhancement bonus to Charisma and may cast <i>remove blindness/deafness</i>,  <i>remove curse</i>,  and <i>remove disease</i> at will. Furthermore, if the <i>Talisman</i> is placed within the <i>Cup</i> and the <i>Cup</i> filled with holy water, that liquid acts as a special elixir of <i>resurrection</i> (as the spell). This effect will function only once per month. Any evil or chaotic creature that touches the <i>Cup</i> or <i>Talisman</i> is struck with a <i>holy word</i> (if evil) or <i>dictum</i> (if chaotic) spell (or both if the creature is chaotic evil).</p>
</div>

name: Eye of the Orc
full_text:
<div topic="Eye of the Orc" level="8"><p><b>Eye of the Orc:</b> This lump of rock has a marquis-cut black sapphire set in its center, making it appear similar to a large eye. If possessed by an orc, it grants a +6 enhancement bonus to Strength and Charisma, and the orc's darkvision range is doubled. Nonorcs who possess the <i>Eye</i> gain a +2 enhancement bonus to Strength but take a -2 penalty to Intelligence and Charisma. Regardless of the owner's race, any weapon wielded by the owner of the <i>Eye</i> is considered an <i>elf bane weapon</i>. Furthermore, by holding the <i>Eye</i> before the character, he or she can perceive things as if he or she had <i>True seeing</i> cast upon him or her. This can be activated only once per day but lasts as long as the character concentrates on it (requiring a standard action each round).</p>
</div>

name: Golem Armor
full_text:
<div topic="Golem Armor" level="8"><p><b>Golem Armor:</b> This enormous suit of black iron +<i>10 full plate armor</i> increases the wearer's size by one category (to a maximum of Colossal). The wearer gains a +10 enhancement bonus to Strength and is rendered immune to mind-affecting effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. He or she is not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage. <i>Golem Armor</i> is immune to rust attacks. The wearer of <i>Golem Armor</i> gains damage reduction 15/adamantine. He or she also cannot regain hit points by any means (mundane or magical) while the armor is worn. It requires 1 hour to don or extract oneself from <i>Golem Armor</i>.</p>
</div>

name: Invulnerable Coat
full_text:
<div topic="Invulnerable Coat" level="8"><p><b>Invulnerable Coat:</b> The <i>Invulnerable Coat</i> +<i>5 chain shirt of heavy fortification</i>. It grants its wearer damage reduction 10/epic and resistance 20 against acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic energy. If the wearer can turn undead, treat the wearer as having +4 class levels for purposes of caster level, turning undead, smiting evil, and laying on hands.</p>
</div>

name: Iron Gauntlet of War
full_text:
<div topic="Iron Gauntlet of War" level="8"><p><b>Iron Gauntlet of War:</b> The <i>Gauntlet</i> grants a +8 enhancement bonus to Strength. The wearer doubles the damage bonus on any smite attacks he or she makes. If the wearer has the Leadership feat, the wearer's Leadership score increases by +4, but the wearer can never attract or keep followers or cohorts who are good or chaotic. Once per day, the wielder can use <i>implosion</i> as a 20th-level caster (DC 23). The <i>Iron Gauntlet of War</i> is intelligent (Int 13, Wis 18, Cha 24, Ego 26) and lawful evil. It can communicate telepathically with its wearer, though it cannot speak. It will always seek to dominate any wearer who isn't lawful evil, forcing such an owner to commit lawful evil deeds (or else find a more suitable wearer).</p>
</div>

name: Ring of Nine Facets
Acid Resistance
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, resist energy
full_text:
<div topic="Acid Resistance" level="8"><p><b>Acid Resistance:</b> A suit of armor or a shield with this property normally has a dull gray appearance. name: Animated

full_text:
<div topic="Animated" level="8"><p><b>Animated:</b> Upon command, an animated shield floats within 2 feet of the wielder, protecting her as if she were using it herself but freeing up both her hands. Only one shield can protect a character at a time. A character with an animated shield still takes any penalties associated with shield use, such as armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance, and nonproficiency.</p><p>Strong transmutation; CL 12th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>animate objects</i>; Price +2 bonus.</p>
</div>

name: Arrow Catching
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, entropic shield
full_text:
<div topic="Arrow Catching" level="8"><p><b>Arrow Catching:</b> A shield with this ability attracts ranged weapons to it. It has a deflection bonus of +1 against ranged weapons because projectiles and thrown weapons veer toward it. Additionally, any projectile or thrown weapon aimed at a target within 5 feet of the shield's wearer diverts from its original target and targets the shield's bearer instead. (If the wielder has total cover relative to the attacker, the projectile or thrown weapon is not diverted.) Additionally, those attacking the wearer with ranged weapons ignore any miss chances that would normally apply. Projectiles and thrown weapons that have an enhancement bonus higher than the shield's base AC bonus are not diverted to the wearer (but the shield's increased AC bonus still applies against these weapons). The wielder can activate or deactivate this ability with a command word.</p><p>Moderate abjuration; CL 8th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>entropic shield</i>; Price +1 bonus.</p>
</div>

name: Arrow Deflection
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, shield
full_text:
<div topic="Arrow Deflection" level="8"><p><b>Arrow Deflection:</b> This shield protects the wielder as if he had the Deflect Arrows feat. Once per round when he would normally be struck by a ranged weapon, he can make a DC 20 Reflex save. If the ranged weapon has an enhancement bonus, the DC increases by that amount. If he succeeds, the shield deflects the weapon. He must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed. Attempting to deflect a ranged weapon doesn't count as an action. Exceptional ranged weapons, such as boulders hurled by giants or <i>acid arrows</i>, can't be deflected.</p><p>Faint abjuration; CL 5th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>shield</i>; Price +2 bonus.</p>
</div>

name: Bashing

full_text:

A bashing shield deals damage as if it were a weapon of two size categories larger (a Medium light shield thus deals 1d6 points of damage and a Medium heavy shield deals 1d8 points of damage). The shield acts as a +1 weapon when used to bash. (Only light and heavy shields can have this ability.)</p><p>Moderate transmutation; CL 8th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>bull's strength</i>; Price +1 bonus.</p>
</div>

name: Banded Mail of Luck
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, bless
full_text:
<div topic="Banded Mail of Luck" level="8"><p><b>Banded Mail of Luck:</b> Ten 100-gp gems adorn this <i>+3 banded mail</i>. Once per week, the armor allows its wearer to require that an attack roll made against him be rerolled. He must take whatever consequences come from the second roll. The wearer's player must decide whether to have the attack roll rerolled before damage is rolled.</p><p>Strong enchantment; CL 12th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>bless</i>; Price 18,900 gp; Cost 10,150 gp + 700 XP.</p>

name: Breastplate of Command
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, mass charm monster
full_text:
<div topic="Breastplate of Command" level="8"><p><b>Breastplate of Command:</b> This finely crafted <i>+2 breastplate</i> radiates a powerful aura of magic. When worn, the armor bestows a dignified and commanding aura upon its owner. The wearer gains a +2 competence bonus on all Charisma checks, including turning checks and Charisma-based skill checks. The wearer also gains a +2 competence bonus to his Leadership score. Friendly troops within 360 feet of the user become braver than normal. Since the effect arises in great part from the distinctiveness of the armor, the wearer cannot hide or conceal herself in any way and still have the effect function.</p><p>Strong enchantment; CL 15th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>mass charm monster</i>; Price 25,400 gp; Cost 10,975 gp + 850 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Celestial Armor
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, creator must be good, fly
full_text:
<div topic="Celestial Armor" level="8"><p><b>Celestial Armor:</b> This bright silver or gold <i>+3 chainmail</i> is so fine and light that it can be worn under normal clothing without betraying its presence. It has a maximum Dexterity bonus of +8, an armor check penalty of -2, and an arcane spell failure chance of 15%. It is considered light armor, weighs 20 pounds, and it allows the wearer to use <i>fly</i> on command (as the spell) once per day.</p><p>Faint transmutation [good]; CL 5th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, creator must be good, <i>fly</i>; Price 22,400 gp; Cost 12,550 gp + 1,004 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Demon Armor
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, contagion
full_text:
<div topic="Demon Armor" level="8"><p><b>Demon Armor:</b> This plate armor is fashioned to make the wearer appear to be a demon. The helmet is shaped to look like a horned demon head, and its wearer looks out of the open, tooth-filled mouth. This <i>+4 full plate</i> allows the wearer to make claw attacks that deal 1d10 points of damage, strike as +1 weapons, and afflict the target as if she had been struck by a <i>contagion</i> spell (Fortitude DC 14 negates). Use of <i>contagion</i> requires a normal melee attack with the claws. The 'claws' are built into the armor's vambraces and gauntlets.</p><p>The armor bestows one negative level on any nonevil creature wearing it. This negative level persists as long as the armor is worn and disappears when the armor is removed. The negative level never results in actual level loss, but it cannot be overcome in any way (including <i>restoration</i> spells) while the armor is worn.</p><p>Strong necromancy [evil]; CL 13th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>contagion</i>; Price 52,260 gp; Cost 26,130 gp + 2,090 XP.</p>
</div>

name: Dragonhide Plate
full_text:
<div topic="Dragonhide Plate" level="8"><p><b>Dragonhide Plate:</b> This suit of full plate is made of dragonhide, rather than metal, so druids can wear it. It is otherwise identical to masterwork full plate.</p><p>No aura (nonmagical); Price 3,300 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Dwarven Plate
full_text:
<div topic="Dwarven Plate" level="8"><p><b>Dwarven Plate:</b> This full plate is made of adamantine, giving its wearer damage reduction of 3/-.</p><p>No aura (nonmagical); Price 16,500 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Elven Chain
full_text:

Speed while wearing elven chain is 30 feet for Medium creatures, or 20 feet for Small. The armor has an arcane spell failure chance of 20%, a maximum Dexterity bonus of +4, and an armor check penalty of -2. It is considered light armor and weighs 20 pounds.</p><p>No aura (nonmagical); Price 4,150 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Mithral Full Plate of Speed
prereq: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, haste
full_text:
<div topic="Mithral Full Plate of Speed" level="8"><p><b>Mithral Full Plate of Speed:</b> As a free action, the wearer of this fine set of <i>+1 mithral full plate</i> can activate it, enabling her to act as though affected by a <i>haste</i> spell for up to 10 rounds each day. The duration of the <i>haste</i> effect need not be consecutive rounds.</p><p>Speed while wearing a suit of mithral full plate is 20 feet for Medium creatures, or 15 feet for Small. The armor has an arcane spell failure chance of 25%, a maximum Dexterity bonus of +3, and an armor check penalty of -3. It is considered medium armor and weighs 25 pounds.</p><p>Faint transmutation; CL 5th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>haste</i>; Price 26,500 gp.</p>
</div>

name: Mithral Shirt

The armor has an arcane spell failure chance of 10%, a maximum Dexterity bonus of +6, and no armor check penalty. It is considered light armor and weighs 10 pounds.</p><p>No aura (nonmagical); Price 1,100 gp.</p>
</div>

The wearer can breathe underwater and can converse with any creature with a language that breathes water.</p><p>Moderate abjuration; CL 11th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, <i>freedom of movement</i>,  <i>water breathing</i>,  <i>tongues</i>; Price 24,650 gp; Cost 17,150 gp + 600 XP.</p>
